abstract: BHP Billiton is looking to address Canadian concerns about lost revenue from its takeover bid for Potash Corp after Saskatchewan province said it would not back the miner’s $39 billion bid.
snippet: BHP Billiton is looking to address Canadian concerns about lost revenue from its takeover bid for Potash Corp after Saskatchewan province said it would not back the miner’s $39 billion bid.

headline.main: Saskatchewan and BHP at Odds on Bid for Potash

abstract: The province’s premier said the transaction would not be a “net benefit” to Canada, the main test for approval under federal law.
snippet: The province’s premier said the transaction would not be a “net benefit” to Canada, the main test for approval under federal law.
lead_paragraph: OTTAWA  Brad Wall, the premier of Saskatchewan, said on Wednesday that he wanted the federal government to block a $38.6 billion takeover by the Australian mining company BHP Billiton of Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, the world’s largest fertilizer company.

headline.main: Saskatchewan Asks Canadian Government to Block BHP Bid for Potash
headline.print_headline: Saskatchewan Asks Canadian Government to Block BHP Bid for Potash

abstract: The province’s premier said the transaction would not be a “net benefit” to Canada, the main test for approval under federal law.
snippet: The province’s premier said the transaction would not be a “net benefit” to Canada, the main test for approval under federal law.
lead_paragraph: Brad Wall, the premier of Saskatchewan, said Wednesday that he wanted the Canadian government to block a $38.6 billion takeover of Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan by the Australian mining company BHP Billiton, the world’s largest fertilizer company, The New York Times reports.

headline.main: Province Chief Wants Canada to Block Potash Bid

abstract: Saskatchewan is expected to formally oppose BHP Billiton’s hostile bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, putting pressure on the Canadian government to block the proposed $38.6 billion takeover.
snippet: Saskatchewan is expected to formally oppose BHP Billiton’s hostile bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, putting pressure on the Canadian government to block the proposed $38.6 billion takeover.
lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton’s hostile bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan has hit a regulatory snag that may derail the proposed $38.6 billion deal before shareholders have their say on the matter.

headline.main: Big Hurdles in Canada for BHP’s Potash Bid
